steps.goal: Create the base HTML file with semantic structure for the calculator
acceptance_criteria: A file named index.html is present in the repository root
The HTML includes a <main> element with a container div having id="calculator"
Inside the container, there is a display element (e.g., <input type="text" readonly>) for showing the current expression and result
A button grid is defined using <button> elements for digits 0‑9, decimal point, operations (+, –, ×, ÷), equals, clear, and backspace
All buttons have descriptive aria-label attributes for accessibility
constraints: No external CSS or JS files – everything must be embedded in index.html
Use only standard HTML5 elements

steps.goal: Add minimal CSS to center the calculator and provide a clean, responsive UI
acceptance_criteria: The calculator container is centered horizontally and vertically on the page
CSS Grid is used to layout the button grid with equal-sized buttons
A neutral color palette (e.g., light gray background, dark text) is applied
The UI scales gracefully on mobile widths (buttons remain tappable)
Hover and active states give visual feedback (e.g., slight background change)
constraints: All CSS must be placed inside a <style> tag in index.html
No external fonts or libraries

steps.goal: Implement JavaScript logic for basic arithmetic operations and user interaction
acceptance_criteria: Clicking a digit or decimal button appends the character to the display
Operation buttons (+, –, ×, ÷) build a valid arithmetic expression
Pressing the equals button evaluates the expression and shows the result
Clear button resets the display, Backspace removes the last character
Keyboard input (0‑9, ., +, -, *, /, Enter, Backspace, Escape) works identically to button clicks
Division by zero is caught and displays an error message (e.g., "Error")
constraints: Do not use eval(); instead use the Function constructor with input validation or a simple parser
All JavaScript must be inside a <script> tag in index.html
No external libraries

steps.goal: Verify functionality and accessibility of the calculator
acceptance_criteria: All acceptance criteria from previous steps are met when the page is opened in a modern browser
Screen reader announces button labels correctly
Responsive layout remains usable on viewport widths from 320px to 1920px
No console errors appear during normal operation
The calculator correctly handles a sequence of mixed operations (e.g., 12+7‑3×2÷4=) following standard left‑to‑right evaluation

architecture.overview: A minimal calculator web application with clean UI centered on the page, supporting basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) with keyboard and mouse input.
components: HTML structure with semantic container elements
CSS for centering, minimal styling, and responsive design
Display area for input and results
Button grid for digits (0-9) and decimal point
JavaScript for calculation logic and event handling
data_flows: User input captured via button clicks or keyboard events
Arithmetic evaluation using safe calculation method
constraints: No external libraries or frameworks
Single HTML file with embedded CSS and JavaScript
Minimal UI with neutral color scheme
Responsive design for different screen sizes
Support for basic operations only (no scientific functions)
decisions: Use CSS Grid for button layout
Implement safe eval() alternative using Function constructor with validation
Support keyboard shortcuts for better UX
Include visual feedback for button interactions
Prevent common errors like division by zero
